title: Any documentation available for r2 other than official book
content: I am interested in learning and using radare2 as a toolset for reverse engineering. But I want ANY other resource for learning this tools other than radare2 book, preferably a video series. What I am interested in is solving crackmes and executables debugging.

comments.text: could you please explain why the negative voting

answers_data.content:
I wrote some articles (search for radare2) about using r2 for crackmes, and there is a talk section on the official website.
Also you can find useful articles from the blog.
Also, feel free to come ask questions on the irc channel.

I think this is what you are looking for:
https://github.com/maijin/workshop2015
And of course just join the chat room on freenode #radare2 and ask questions.

comments.text: this is great but this looks like a slides for some videos where can I find these videos thanks
From his besides keynote. But it's good enough.
No videos yet for my slides sorry :(

answers_data.content: We collect useful links about using radare2 on our forum  (jvoisin blog too :) )

comments.text: In fact, even if you link may be valuable, the policy of Stack-exchange is to prefer lengthy (and, as much as possible, self-contained) explanation. Pointing to external website is not really a good idea, especially if you do only that.
Sry, corrected. Author ask resources about using and I pointed place where we collect request things (I have got a same question/problem early).
No problem! I don't blame you in particular. I just remember the rule for everybody! :-) (you seems to be upvoted anyway, so your answer must be somehow relevant for some users).
